result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeron L. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeron L. Wilson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeron L. Wilson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Payable at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting November 1, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
May serve on EMP.  Sentence to start on or before 30 days from October 5, 2015 no later than 6:00 P.M.

Defendant called and will drop off a letter tomorrow with the Clerk of Courts asking for an extension to pay. Otherwise, he cannot pay until at least Nov. 15. He was advised to be sure to bring in his request tomorrow and to also make a payment on NOv. 15.
of 9/21 plea/sentencing hearing notice, of 10/5 plea/sentencing hearing notice, JOC & payment plan.   All RTS, unclaimed, UTF

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Dominguez.  No victim response, per ADA Inlow.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 2.  No joint recommendation.  Count 1 dismissed.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  He understands.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  He understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charge in the complaint.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 2.  State recommends 45 days jail.   Credit for 5 days served.  Defense recommends 14 days jail.  Serve on EMP.  30 days to report.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered: 45 days jail.  Credit for 5 days served.  CC   Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Serve on EMP.  30 days to report.  Pay costs @ $50/mo starting 11/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
